metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4491 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The d_print_comp function in cp-demangle.c in libiberty allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via acrafted binary, which triggers infinite recursion and a buffer overflow,related to a node having "itself as ancestor more than once."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: valgrind package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2').
ht: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
